interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Channel.Interface.SaslAuthentication.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: A channel interface for SASL authentication.

property.name: AvailableMechanisms
property.tp:docstring: Example: [ "PLAIN", "DIGEST-MD5", "SCRAM-SHA-1" ] The SASL mechanisms as offered by the server.

property.name: Secure
property.tp:docstring: Is this exchange secure (ie. TLS)? Good to know if you need to take a calculated risk with plaintext.

property.name: CurrentChallenge
property.tp:docstring: The current challenge from the server. change notification via NewChallenge. The handler either needs to respond by calling Respond (if it needs to send reply data), Accept (If the challenge contained final data) or Abort (in case of errors).

property.name: CurrentState
property.tp:docstring: The current state of the authentication. Change notification via StateChanged signal.

method.name: StartMechanism

arg.name: InitialData
arg.tp:docstring: Initial data to send with the mechanism.

method.tp:docstring: Start an authentication try using Mechanism. If the choosen SASL mechanism is client-first then the first data must be passed in InitialData, otherwise InitialData must be an empty array.

method.name: Respond
method.tp:docstring: Our response to the CurrentChallenge if required.

method.name: Accept
method.tp:docstring: Handler accepts the authentication as finished. Can be called whenever the Handler considered the authentication process to be (successfully) finished from its part.

signal.name: NewChallenge
signal.tp:docstring: Recieved a new challenge from the server.

arg.name: ChallengeData
arg.tp:docstring: The challenge data from the server.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Server sent an invalid challenge or data.
Need to call StartMechanism to start.
Server indicated successful authentication, handler needs to Accept or Abort.
Handler indicates that from its perspective the authentication has successfully finished.
Everyone is happy (server sent success, client sent Accept), up to the handler to close the channel.
Server indicated an authentication failure, Authentication can be restarted by calling StartMechanism again or completely aborted by Closing the channel.
Client indicated an authentication failure, Authentication can be restarted by calling StartMechanism again or completely aborted by Closing the channel.
